form.onsubmit: if(this.search_block_form.value=='Search'){ alert('Please enter a search'); return false; }

ul.class: menu sf-menu sf-main-menu sf-horizontal sf-style-none sf-total-items-6 sf-parent-items-1 sf-single-items-5

li.class: last even sf-item-6 sf-depth-1 sf-total-children-4 sf-parent-children-0 sf-single-children-4 menuparent

div.div: Home covid-19 resources COVID-19 Remote Learning Resources

img.alt: Due to the fluidity of the COVID-19 situation, this page has been updated for ease of use. If you have questions, please email IDOECOVID-19@doe.in.gov. Federal, state, and local health officials are currently taking steps to address the COVID-19 pandemic. This webpage is designed to provide schools access to guidance on operational policies and procedures as the situation evolves. Please check back often for updates.

ul.li: Charter Communications - announced on March 13, 2020 that for 60 days the company will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access to homes with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a subscription. Installation fees will also be waived for these households. Enroll by calling 844-488-8395. Charter will also continue Spectrum Internet Assist, a program offering low-cost broadband internet of 30 Mbps for low-income households without school-aged children.

Comcast, which owns Xfinity, will offer 60 days free and increased speeds for new families who join the Internet Essentials program, an internet access program for low income families that is normally $9.95 a month.

AT&T announced it would not cancel service and would waive late fees for any wireless, home phone, broadband residential or small business customer experiencing hardships because of the coronavirus pandemic and can't pay their bills. Qualifying low income households can apply for $10 a month internet access through the Access from AT&T program. Fixed Wireless Internet and Wireline customers can use unlimited internet data. AT&T will also keep public Wi-Fi hotspots open.

div.em: Click on link below for regional television schedules for grade level and subject programming. Check back every week to view the new schedules.

p.a: At Home Learning IPBS Episode Reflection Guide
At Home Learning PBS KIDS Conversation Cards

li.a: PBS Fort Wayne At Home Learning - Week of April 19
Lakeshore PBS At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WFYI 1 At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WFYI 3 At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WIPB 49.1 At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WNIN At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WNIT Channel 34.1 At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WNIT Channel 34.5 At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WTIU At Home Learning - Week of April 19
WVUT At Home Learning - Week of April 19

ul.li:
English Language Learner
eLearning Resources - English Learners - This hub features resources for both teachers and families of English learner students. Included are links to other EL-specific resource hubs, such as WIDA’s, links for effectively connecting with multilingual families, and instructional programs and supports.
eLearning Requirements and Supports for English Learners - IDOE’s guidance on the requirements for providing services, communicating with families, and assessing English learner students.

High Ability
Online resources for High Ability remote learning

Special Education
Office of Special Education COVID-19 Resources & Information
Continuous Learning and Accommodations (April 10, 2020)
eLearning Day Program Guidance for Students with Disabilities
IDOE eLearning Day Program - resources to assist schools in implementing eLearning days
SETDA Coalition for eLearning - resources and guidance for online learning
Learning Keeps Going - a curation of free tools, strategies, tips and best practices for teaching online from a coalition of education organizations

Rose-Hulman PRISM Rose-Hulman PRISM provides a free Moodle LMS for any Indiana K-12 teachers. Teachers can build / author their own courses on the LMS. PRISM staff will provide online Moodle training if needed and daily support. Teachers can build as many courses on the LMS as needed. Teachers can continue to use the LMS indefinitely. This is not an offer for just the current time.
ASUforYOU - School Training - Free short videos for teachers and families to learn the basics of how to transition your instruction online.

li.a: IDOE Guidance for Schools to Partner with DCS in Promoting Child Welfare and Continuity of Learning
Department of Education Child Safety Tips

li.strong: Search the Resource Database below for content specific supports.

ul.li: TV and Movie watching templates for Elementary and Secondary students - IDOE wants to ensure learning continues for students at home. These templates are meant to provide an opportunity for students to learn and grow while watching a TV show or movie.

AskRose Homework Help - A free math and science tutoring service for Indiana students and other students in grades 6-12. Students can call 877-ASK-ROSE, email, or chat live with a friendly tutor to work through and better understand homework assignments.
ASU for You Free Online Tutoring - Tutoring sessions for Math, ELA, Science and Social Studies via ZOOM.
March 23 – May 20 2:00-3:00pm EDT - Monday: Math | Tuesday: Science | Wednesday: Math | Thursday: Science | Friday: Math
March 23 – May 20 3:00-4:00pm EDT - Monday: Language Arts | Tuesday: Social Studies | Wednesday: Language Arts | Thursday: Social Studies | Friday: Language Arts

li.a: Fred Rogers Center - Talking to Young Children about the Coronavirus
CDC - Talking to young children about coronavirus

ul.li: PBS - How to Talk to Your Kids About Coronavirus (with PBS Kids videos and shows that discuss handwashing)
NASP - Talking to children about COVID-19

div.p: Choose the grade level and content area for which you want to search. The results will show below. Click on the link to discover more about each resource! You can submit a resource here.

div.div: Search narrows as you select more.
Search narrows as you select more.

table.class: views-table cols-1 table table-striped table-hover table-0 table-0

td.a: American Council for Teaching Foreign Languages (ACTFL)
Arts for Learning: Indiana Affiliate of Young Audiences

img.alt: These resources have not been vetted by IDOE, nor should this be considered an endorsement. Educators should be mindful of digital resources that require teachers or students to create online accounts. Please check district policies and consider HIPPA, FERPA, and COPPA laws with regards to students privacy BEFORE implementing any of these resources.

li.a: COVID-19 Weekly Webinar for School Leaders

ul.li:
Sign Up for Dr. McCormick's
Weekly Update

Follow us
on social media

div.p: IDOE wants to hear from you! Contact us with comments, suggestions, and feedback on how we can make things better. You can call (317) 232-6610, email us or use our online form Contact Us.

South Tower, Suite 600
115 W. Washington Street
Indianapolis, IN 46204
